Gibson (9 August 1934 – 18 September 2019) was a Canadian novelist.Graeme Gibson's entry in The Canadian Encyclopedia. He was a Member of the Order of Canada (1992). He was one of the organizers of the Writer's Union of Canada (chair, 1974–75). He was also a founder of the Writers' Trust of Canada. Gibson was in a partnership with fellow Canadian novelist Margaret Atwood from 1973 until his death. In April 2017, Gibson was diagnosed with dementia. He died on 18 September 2019 in a hospital in London, England at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Writers from Toronto Category:Writers from London, Ontario
